alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Clay; Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 27 at 10:05PM EDT until July 28 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Breathitt County in southeastern Kentucky... Northeastern Clay County in southeastern Kentucky... East Central Owsley County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 100 AM EDT. * At 1005 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gobbard, Sebastian, Ricetown, Lucky Fork, Southfork, Taff, Trixie, Conkling, Arnett, Major, Valjean and Morris Fork. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
